news.headline: AT&T CEO: AI's power shortages could become America's "next economic social issue" - Fortune Global Forum
news.summary: The Fortune Global Forum will convene October 26–27 in Riyadh, Saudi Arabia. The event will explore the strategies that will define the next era of business growth. AT&T CEO John Stankey: AI power shortages could be America’s next economic social issue.
news.article_text: AT&T CEO John Stankey told the Fortune Global Forum in 2024 that AI power shortages could be America’s next economic social issue. This year, the Fortune Global Forum will convene October 26–27 in Riyadh, Saudi Arabia, to explore the strategies that will define the next era of business growth.

news.headline: Will Dollar Tree's Strategic Initiatives and Store Expansions Aid?
news.summary: Dollar Tree has been making smart moves to enrich shoppers’ experience and bolster growth. The number of customers who visit a Dollar Tree store three or more times in a month or more increased 11% in the second quarter, up from 9% seen in the previous quarter.
news.article_text:
Dollar Tree, Inc. DLTR has been making smart moves to enrich shoppers’ experience and bolster growth. The company’s strategic initiatives, including its ongoing store conversions and expansions, have successfully boosted same-store sales (comps) by attracting more customers and increasing average spending.

news.headline: How Dollar Tree’s New Oklahoma Distribution Center May Shape Supply Chain Resilience for DLTR Investors
news.summary: On September 24, 2025, Dollar Tree broke ground on a new one million sq. ft. distribution center in Marietta, Oklahoma, replacing a facility lost to a tornado in April 2024. The key thesis for Dollar Tree centers on its ability to harness consumer demand for value and convenience
news.article_text:
On September 24, 2025, Dollar Tree broke ground on a new one million sq. ft. distribution center in Marietta, Oklahoma, replacing a facility lost to a tornado in April 2024 and pledging US$50,000 in grants to local organizations.

This project highlights Dollar Tree's commitment to restoring regional operations, supporting 700 stores and returning 400 jobs to the community.

We'll explore how the major new distribution center investment may impact Dollar Tree’s supply chain resilience and growth

news.headline: Jim Cramer Says Dollar Tree Benefits From Value Seeking Consumers
news.summary: Dollar Tree, Inc. (NASDAQ:DLTR) operates discount retail stores under the Dollar Tree brand. The company’s stores offer low-cost products across everyday, variety, and holiday categories.
news.article_text:
Dollar Tree, Inc. (NASDAQ:DLTR) is one of the relatively cheap S&P 500 stocks Jim Cramer talked about. Cramer said that it is the only consumer staples stock he likes. He stated:

“After that, there’s Dollar Tree. Now that’s the only member of the consumer staples that I like from this list. I think Dollar Tree can win in this environment as a destination for lower-income consumers who are searching for value. I like that they finally spun off that weaker Family Dollar business. news.headline: Dollar Tree begins construction of Oklahoma distribution hub
news.summary: Dollar Tree has commenced the construction of a new distribution centre in Marietta, Oklahoma. The new site will cover one million square feet and be fully operational by spring 2027. The facility will supply 700 Dollar Tree stores in the western and southwestern US.
news.article_text:
The facility will supply 700 Dollar Tree stores in the western and southwestern US. Credit: Brett Hondow / Shutterstock.com

US retail giant Dollar Tree has commenced the construction of a new distribution centre in Marietta, Oklahoma, to replace a facility destroyed by a tornado in April 2024.

The new site will cover one million square feet and be fully operational by spring 2027.
